intro: Canavalia lasiocalyx, commonly known as the woolly jackbean, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a legume, belonging to the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its distinctive hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional cuisines. Canavalia lasiocalyx thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural purposes.
